meanings.definition: A monetary unit of Russia and some other countries, equal to one hundredth of a ruble.
meanings.sent1: In Russia, people use kopecks to buy small things like candies.
meanings.sent2: I found a few kopecks in my pocket while doing laundry.
meanings.sent3: The vending machine only accepted kopecks, so I had to search for some in my bag.
meanings.sent4: Her savings were like scattered kopecks, small but adding up over time.
meanings.sent5: The sound of kopecks jingling in the jar was music to her ears.

meanings.sent1: The beggar was grateful for the kopeck given by a kind passerby.
meanings.sent2: I always keep a few kopecks in my wallet for emergencies.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child pretended to be a rich king with a single kopeck in hand.
meanings.sent4: The old man's eyes lit up as he found a rare kopeck in his collection.
meanings.sent5: The shiny kopeck gleamed under the sunlight, catching everyone's attention.
